tasks.task: Conduct research on blue tongue virus transmission and vaccine development.
subtasks: Breeding biting midges in an insectary.
Use mammalian hosts (sheep, goats, cattle) for blue tongue virus research.
Monitor and treat study animals with painkillers if necessary.
Perform infection studies using primary cell cultures.
Collect midge saliva for saliva-induced pathogen transmission research.
Develop methods to minimize animal use in research through alternative approaches.
Understand blue tongue virus serotype variation and re-assortment.
Evaluate vaccine efficacy and immune response in animals.

tasks.task: Manage animal movements and implement movement restrictions to prevent virus spread.
subtasks: Identify and isolate infected animals quickly to prevent local infection spread.
Restrict animal movement to control the spread of the virus within an area.
Quarantine new animals upon arrival to prevent introducing the virus.

tasks.task: Develop strategies for emergency vaccine development in response to new strains.
subtasks: Assess the virulence and potential epidemic potential of new strains.
Rapidly develop and test vaccines against emerging strains.
Monitor the effectiveness of vaccines and adjust strategies as necessary.
